meanings.definition: A person of noble or high rank in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The patrician was respected by all for his high status.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed artifacts belonging to the patrician class.
meanings.sent3: The patrician's toga was so fancy, it made everyone else jealous.
meanings.sent4: She carried herself like a patrician, exuding grace and authority.
meanings.sent5: The patrician's villa overlooked the entire city, a symbol of power and privilege.

meanings.definition: A person of refined upbringing and manners.
meanings.sent1: The elderly lady was a true patrician, always polite and elegant.
meanings.sent2: He learned proper etiquette from his patrician grandmother.
meanings.sent3: The patrician's tea party was the talk of the town, with impeccable manners all around.
meanings.sent4: Her patrician demeanor made her the perfect hostess for the evening.
meanings.sent5: The patrician's handwriting was as elegant as her speech, a mark of her upbringing.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the aristocracy or upper class.
meanings.sent1: The patrician lifestyle was filled with luxury and privilege.
meanings.sent2: She wore a patrician gown to the royal ball, fitting right in with the elite.
meanings.sent3: The patrician party was so exclusive, even the butler couldn't get in!
meanings.sent4: His patrician taste in art was evident in every piece displayed in his mansion.
meanings.sent5: The patrician neighborhood was known for its grand mansions and well-manicured gardens.
